Articles.Content: <p><figure class="tmblr-full" data-orig-height="92" data-orig-width="480"><img data-orig-height="92" data-orig-width="480" src="http://40.media.tumblr.com/e6b9796e0425d604ccf4dd4df2733721/tumblr_inline_nxpkqqZtNj1rr2wit_540.jpg" alt="image"/></figure></p><p><iframe src="http://player.twitch.tv/?video=v24533799" frameborder="0" scrolling="no" height="378" width="620"></iframe><br/></p><p>EJ hosts a show on KSPTV, our official Twitch livestreaming channel, every Wednesday starting next week. During last week’s 1.0.5 preview streams he tried to land one of his monstrosities, an awesome Boeing 747 replica, in the water. Belly-landing the aircraft at just over 400 kilometres per hour (250mph) proved to be stressful on the construction though!</p>

Typically KSP:

-Ok, lets try this.

-Ship explodes

-"You know, that was not bad."
